lcInstruction.p: At a minimum, the task topic must contain a <task> root element (with an id attribute) that contains a <title> element.

Following the <title> element and an optional <shortdesc> element, a <taskbody> element contains the task content. The elements within the <taskbody> conform to a specific order. This course presents the elements of the <taskbody> in the order in which they must occur.

step.cmd: Make a copy of the file l_task_start.dita and open it in your editor.

info.note: If you are using a DITA-aware text editor, make sure you are in text mode, rather than author or visual mode.

step.cmd: Inside the <title> element, update the text of the task title.
After the <title> element, add a <taskbody> element.
step.info: The <taskbody> element contains all the actual content in the task.
This is the essential part of a DITA strict task topic. The rest of this lesson shows you how to add the first two child elements to the <taskbody> element.
